a.text: {{setup}}You finally make eye contact in an elevator… and someone actually asks, “How’s your day going?”{{turn}}You muster a smile and reply, “Great!” even though your to-do list is screaming *TRAGEDY*.{{tag}}Receipt: (1/1) Politeness: our way of pretending interest while both of you are just screaming for the doors to open.

b.text: {{Setup}}: In the elevator, everyone avoids eye contact like a gaze is contagious. {{Turn}}: A stranger suddenly asks, "How're things?" while staring at their shoes. {{Tag}}: Receipt: (1/1) Proof of purchase: $0.00 for eye contact, $100 for pretending to care.

a.text:
Rule of Three:  
1) Greet the silence like a familiar friend.  
2) When the doors ding, stare ahead *more aggressively* to prove you’re not ignoring anyone.  
3) Exit while whispering “Great meeting!” to the air, because mystery builds connection.

b.text: {{Setup}}: In the elevator, everyone avoids eye contact like a gaze is contagious. {{Turn}}: A stranger suddenly asks, "How're things?" while staring at their shoes. {{Tag}}: Receipt: (1/1) Proof of purchase: $0.00 for eye contact, $100 for pretending to care.

Rule of Efficiency:  
1) Use “Great meeting!” as default small talk.  
2) Add 5 more phrases like “Synergy!” to the script.  
3) PM sends a memo clarifying “just smile,” now no one speaks at all.

a.text:
Rule of Synergy:  
1) Invent a “synergy” update to kick things off,  
2) Mention “disrupting the staircase industry” to clarify intentions,  
3) PM’s memo urges “authentic human connection”—everyone frantically checks the emergency override button.

b.text:
Rule of Efficiency:  
1) Use “Great meeting!” as default small talk.  
2) Add 5 more phrases like “Synergy!” to the script.  
3) PM sends a memo clarifying “just smile,” now no one speaks at all.

a.text:
**Virtual Vibes Rule:**  
1) Enter like you’re all on a Zoom call,  
2) Half the crowd stays “on mute” (literally),  
3) When someone echoes “Can you hear me?” laugh as the doors… *ding*… and stall.

b.text: Rule of Virtual Stagnation: 1) Pretend to check messages to fake prior connection. 2) When another passenger does the same, panic—now it’s a group call with half on mute. 3) The elevator stops; you’re reenacting “deck won’t load” and “meeting runs long”… in real life.

a.text:
**Virtual Vibes Rule:**  
1) Enter like you’re all on a Zoom call,  
2) Half the crowd stays “on mute” (literally),  
3) When someone echoes “Can you hear me?” laugh as the doors… *ding*… and stall.

b.text:
Rule of Virtual Torture:  
1) Greet everyone as if joining a Zoom call mid-lag.  
2) When someone responds, gasp and whisper, “You were on mute!”  
3) Complain the elevator’s “deck” won’t load—then push “lobby” repeatedly like a refresh button.

a.text: Rule of Resolution: 1) Greet strangers with “Great workout!” (even if they’re just standing there). 2) By March, pretend they’re your gym buddy from January. 3) Exit calling them “Bro”—now you’re both that guy filming squats.

b.text: Rule of Resolution: 1) Nod like you’re part of a gym crew. 2) By March, only the guy filming his squats returns. 3) Compliment his form—statue of Liberty had better posture.

a.text: Rule of Resolution: 1) Nod like you’re part of a gym crew. 2) By March, only the guy filming his squats returns. 3) Compliment his form—statue of Liberty had better posture.

b.text: Rule of Resolution: 1) Greet strangers with “Great workout!” (even if they’re just standing there). 2) By March, pretend they’re your gym buddy from January. 3) Exit calling them “Bro”—now you’re both that guy filming squats.

a.text: {{Setup}} You step aside to avoid eye contact in the elevator. {{Turn}} They beam and shout, "How's your *DAY?!" from the opposite corner. {{Tag}} Receipt: (1/1) Small talk—when we perform connection at a distance, like actors rehearsing "politeness" for an audience of ceiling buttons.

b.text:
**Corporate Elevator Etiquette:**  
1) Greet strangers with *"Maximizing synergy potential!"* as if the elevator’s cramped space is a boardroom.  
2) Leverage their awkward silence into a *"collaboration opportunity"* by pointing at the emergency button.  
3) Circle back to the conversation on exit with *"Let’s disrupt this elevator’s velocity!"* while sprinting to the wrong floor.

a.text:
**Corporate Elevator Etiquette:**  
1) Greet strangers with *"Maximizing synergy potential!"* as if the elevator’s cramped space is a boardroom.  
2) Leverage their awkward silence into a *"collaboration opportunity"* by pointing at the emergency button.  
3) Circle back to the conversation on exit with *"Let’s disrupt this elevator’s velocity!"* while sprinting to the wrong floor.

b.text:
Rule of Corporate Silence:  
1) Greet them with *"Let’s leverage this elevator time for maximum synergy!"*  
2) If they fake email-checking, suggest *"We’ll circle back post-floor-reach."*  
3) Smile knowingly—because nothing says *"connection"* like phrases that mean nothing.
